intro: Paepalanthus cephalotrichus, commonly known as the silky sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage and showy pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
